alert.note: Alert for Greene; Hale; Sumter; Tuscaloosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 11:16PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Tuscaloosa, Greene, northern Hale and northwestern Sumter Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1115 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Gordo to near Johnston Lake to near Panola. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Livingston, Eutaw, Moundville, Forkland, Akron, Boligee, Union, Gainesville, Epes, Emelle, Panola, Walden Quarters, West Greene, Thornhill, Wedgeworth, Tishabee, New West Greene, Mantua, Allison and Jena. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for central and west central Alabama.
